text:
Marinette, we've decided to ask
Marc and Nathaniel for help.

If anyone can come up with
the perfect plan for you

to finally tell Adrien
you love him, it's them.

- What? Are you serious?
- Yeah. So?

So they all know about me and
how I feel about you know who?

Alix: Everyone knows
that you're crushing on Adrien!
Even Adrien?

Adrien is probably
the only one who doesn't know.

Of course. Otherwise,
there'd be no story.

We chose Marc and Nath
because as you know,

they're the experts
in romantic comedies.
Marc writes and Nath draws.

And since they succeeded
at inventing a love story

for Ladybug and Cat Noir
in their first comic book,

they're sure to think up
the perfect plot
between you and Adrien.

Your story with Adrien
seems really complicated.
But it's actually very simple.

It's just like
a fairytale. Nath?

Nathaniel: Usually,
a mean old witch imprisons

a princess in a castle
guarded by a dragon

and a knight in shining armor
has to save her.
Well, this is the same story,

except you're the knight,
Marinette,

Adrien's the princess,
the castle is his home.

and the witch is his father
Gabriel Agreste.

I'd have thought
his father was the king.
Or the dragon.

His bodyguard
would be the dragon.
He looks the part.

He looks more
like a gorilla.

The main obstacle in
a fairy tale can be the dragon.

Or the witch.
In Marinette and Adrien's story,
it's Gabriel Agreste.

But the witch Agreste
has made a mistake.

He's been letting his son out
of the castle to go to school.

And that's where
the good fairies come in.

- Us.
- Every week, we'll think up

a new plan so that the knight
can finally kiss the princess,

and they can finally live
happily ever after
with buckets of hamsters.

And the plan will
always take place in the one

and only location
where the witch can't get to,

- which is...
- The school!

A-ha! You forgot me
in your ridiculous fairy tale!

- Aah! The terrifying ogre!
- The big bad wolf.

- The ugly toad.
- Your worst nightmare. Hm!

Marc: But the witch Agreste
has made a mistake.

He's been letting his son out
of the castle to go to school.
Thanks to this video,

I'm going to ruin
Dupain-Cheng's fairy tale.

Tonight, I'll show this video
to his father, who will realize

that you're trying to
take his son away from him

and make him fall in love
with a baker girl.

Then he'll lock Adrien up
in his room forever

and forbid him to come
back to school, and poof!

There goes your fairy tale.
Adrien will never see you again.
Good for him.

I thought you were happy that
Adrien was coming to school.

He'll be better off alone
at home than surrounded

by a bunch
of lame-os at school.

And then maybe he'll
be lucky enough to go back

to being my prince charming,
whom I've always adored.

Adrien was never your
prince charming, Chloe.

We'll see about that,
Dupain-Cheng.
Sabrina, ninja smoke screen.
Hm!
( grunts, sighs )

She won't do anything.
Not tonight or ever.

The witch, I mean,
Gabriel Agreste

doesn't just let anyone
walk into his house.

Normally, that's true,
but actually,
there's a dinner party tonight,

and all his friends
are invited
with their children.
Chloe will be there.
Yeah, but so will her mother,
who's your mother.
So you'll be there, too.

You'll be able
to stop her, right?
My darling half-sister Chloe
managed to convince our mother
not to bring me with them.
She really is a piece of work.

We just have to pretend
like we're in a fairy tale.

The knight simply
has to go to the ball

to stop the evil Chloe
from showing the video
to the witch Agreste.

The knight can't
get into the ball.

The ball is off limits
to knights.
Unless the knight is wearing...
Nath: A disguise.
( gasps )

Jean-Quentin,
did my mother tell you

the dinner party's no longer
at Gabriel Agreste's tonight?

Oh, no. Madame didn't
mention anything to me.

A helicopter will be coming
to the roof

to take you over
to the Eiffel Tower.

Is mademoiselle
sure about this?

Excuse me. Are you suggesting
that I might be wrong?

Ridiculous.
Utterly ridiculous.

Sorry,
but it's for a good cause.
( vibrating )

Zoe: The butler
is out of the picture.
The knight can take his place.
There. Perfect!
